channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Gemma Sisley: Brother mortified by 2008 killer's open jail move
item.description: Jason Burrows, who strangled his ex-partner to death, has been approved for an open prison.

item.title: Lewis Bloor trial: Towie star 'left £3m diamond scam for ITV show'
item.description: Lewis Bloor upset "fellow fraudsters" when he left an alleged diamond scam for TV life, court hears.

item.title: Sabina Nessa murder: Family left devastated by teacher's death in Kidbrooke
item.description: Her cousin pays tribute to the primary school teacher describing her as a "beautiful soul".

item.title: The Cumbrian walking group going strong after 20 years
item.description: The weekly group in Cumbria was set up in 1998 for former bank colleagues to stay in contact.

item.title: Victorian ticket ledger found at March railway station
item.description: The luggage ledger dates back to April 1885, when the railway station opened.

item.title: Liverpool man in Afghanistan still waiting for evacuation news
item.description: The Liverpool man is still desperately waiting for him and his wife and children to be evacuated.

item.title: Isle of Wight NHS Trust staff 'go extra mile' for patients
item.description: Isle of Wight NHS Trust is rated good by the health watchdog and praised for its patient care.

item.title: Girl's death linked to acne drug, mum tells inquest
item.description: The 15-year-old's mother says she told doctors she had heard of suicides linked to Roaccutane use.

item.title: Rare Charles I coin fetches £44k at auction
item.description: The coin was minted in Oxford during the English Civil War and had the value of three pounds.

item.title: Liverpool fugitive jailed after Christmas Day meal arrest
item.description: Daniel Burdett and his brother imported "assassin kits" into the UK from the Netherlands.

item.title: Dame Sarah Storey: Paralympian abused during cycling safety drive
item.description: Dame Sarah Storey was supporting a police operation to encourage drivers to pass cyclists safely.

item.title: Walsall councillor blocked from deputy mayor role due to mental health issues
item.description: Sean Coughlan says the decision by Tory councillors seems "archaic".

item.title: Extra £1m for Plymouth shootings community
item.description: Plymouth MP Luke Pollard said he has been receiving mental health support following the shootings.

item.title: Manchester Arena Inquiry: Bomb victim's mother praises PC's actions
item.description: The officer placed T-shirts over the body of Philip Tron after the Manchester Arena attack.

item.title: Killamarsh: Man in court charged with murdering three children and woman
item.description: Damien Bendall is accused of murdering Terri Harris and three children at a house in Derbyshire.

item.title: Newborn donkey rejected by mother moves into Skegness house
item.description: Kye the donkey is being hand-reared and wearing nappies as he is looked after in the family home.

item.title: Vauxhall Motors plans Luton job losses amid chip crisis
item.description: The Unite union says it will "do everything in our power to mitigate or prevent" job losses.

item.title: Jonathon Seed: Wiltshire PCC election winner charged with making false declaration
item.description: Jonathon Seed was elected to the post but withdrew after a historic driving conviction came to light.

item.title: Manchester flooding: Major incident after burst water main
item.description: Two busy Manchester city centre roads are shut after a large water main bursts near the university.

item.title: Lancashire Police hunting on-the-run convicted rapist
item.description: Police say Kevin Anthony Wyatt is "a high-risk offender" and should not be approached.

item.title: Library book returned to UK from Canada 18 years late
item.description: Bullies Don't Hurt was due back at Salisbury Library in 2003 but arrived from Quebec last week.

item.title: Peter Sutcliffe: Serial killer refused Covid shielding measures
item.description: Crispin Oliver tells relatives he hopes the serial killer's death will bring a "sense of closure".

item.title: Teenager in Peterborough e-scooter near-miss with bus
item.description: The 16-year-old is sentenced after CCTV sees him almost colliding with the vehicle in Peterborough.

item.title: Virtual reality helps Stafford cancer patients
item.description: From Phuket to the Peak District - cancer patients visit sun-kissed beaches without leaving hospice.

item.title: School helps buy treadmill so Newmarket boy can walk
item.description: Doctors feared Bryson, aged nine, might never walk or talk after being born premature.

item.title: Tyneside foodbank's concerns over Universal Credit cut
item.description: Hebburn Helps fears there will be a rise in foodbank users as the £20 Universal Credit uplift goes.

item.title: Drink driver's erratic journey captured on his own dashcam
item.description: Footage shows David Leahy knocking down a street sign, mounting kerbs and hitting a parked car.

item.title: Dan Burton: Family 'heartbroken' after fatal air crash
item.description: Dan Burton, who died during a round-Britain challenge, was "dedicated to exploration", his family say.

item.title: Bristol cancer survivor bids for better mental health care
item.description: Teenage Cancer Trust asks government to fund specialised therapy for young cancer patients.

item.title: Windsor Castle reveals huge equestrian production for Platinum Jubilee
item.description: A Gallop Through History will take place in the grounds of Windsor Castle in May.

item.title: Harry Dunn: Family aim to 'forge ahead' with criminal case
item.description: Harry Dunn's mother, Charlotte Charles, says the resolution of a civil case is a relief.

item.title: HMP Bronzefield baby death: Mother was 'failed' says inspectors
item.description: Inspectors say the death of the newborn baby at HMP Bronzefield "should never have happened'.

item.title: Manchester United 0-1 West Ham: Lanzini puts Hammers into fourth round of Carabao Cup
item.description: West Ham gain revenge for Sunday's Premier League defeat by Manchester United by knocking their hosts out of the Carabao Cup at Old Trafford.

item.title: Derby County officially enter administration and are deducted 12 points
item.description: Championship side Derby County enter administration and are deducted 12 points by the English Football League.

item.title: County Championship: Danny Briggs swings title race towards Warwickshire
item.description: Danny Briggs hits 20 in an over off Somerset's Jack Brooks to claim a fourth batting point and swing the title race Warwickshire's way.

item.title: County Championship: James Vince helps Hampshire revive title hopes against Lancashire
item.description: Hampshire captain James Vince makes 69 to help build a 160-run lead over Lancashire on day two at Aigburth.

item.title: County Championship: Essex clinch Division Two title with innings victory
item.description: Essex clinch the Division Two title after beating Northants by an innings and 44 runs before lunch on day two at Chelmsford.
